Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
radioactive \ra`di*o*ac"tive\ (r[=a]`d[i^]*[-o]*[a^]k"t[i^]v), a. [Radio- + active.] 1. (Physics) Capable of luminescence under the action of cathode rays, X rays, or any of the allied forms of radiation. [obsolete] [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
2. (Physics) of, exhibiting, or caused by {radioactivity}. [PJC]
radioactive adj : exhibiting or caused by radioactivity; "radioactive isotope"; "radioactive decay"; "radioactive fallout" [ant: {nonradioactive}]
